Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "NuGet.org HaTS survey banner" (#8225) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Merged pull request "Darken social buttons for accessibility" (#8220) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
For WCAG 2.1, web components must have a 3:1 contrast ratio. This darkens the social media icons on the display package page.

Before:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/94204286-cfd9af00-fe75-11ea-87a9-f1e37d5a73af.png)

After:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/737941/94204293-d405cc80-fe75-11ea-88dc-908b5a586fb0.png)

Addresses https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/8185

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Performance: Reduce UIDelays in GetPackageSpecsAsync for Legacy projects and non PR projects" (#9953) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
There are plenty of UI delays causes in this codepaths that affect codepaths at initialization and more importantly restore.

There are many related issues here, so consider this an epic if necessary. 

The goal here is to reduce the impact of legacy project on all NuGet operations. 

Issues: https://devdiv.visualstudio.com/DevDiv/_workitems/edit/1168242

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Referenced dll, pack does not work" (#7508) at NuGet/Home
Closed issue "Nuget command line parameters are inconsistent" (#8555) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
When using nuget.exe I was looking for help. So I naturally tried the various common ways to get the help output:
```
nuget /?
nuget -?
nuget --?
nuget -help
nuget /help
nuget --help
```
All of them returned:
```
Unknown command: '/?'
NuGet.CommandLine.CommandLineException: Unknown command: '/?'
   at NuGet.CommandLine.CommandManager.GetCommand(String commandName)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.CommandLineParser.ParseCommandLine(IEnumerable`1 commandLineArgs)
   at NuGet.CommandLine.Program.MainCore(String workingDirectory, String[] args)
```
Instead it turns out the command is
`nuget help` or `nuget ?`
This is a bit against common convention.
However it gets weirder. I needed help for the `nuget config` command, so now having learned you add `help` without a dash, I entered this:
```
c:\>nuget config help
Key 'help' not found.
```

It turns out that in this specific case, you must use a dash in front of the command: `nuget config -help`

This is rather inconsistent. The quick fix would allow `nuget -help`  and `nuget -?` (or forward slash on Windows) to be the common documented approach, as it's in alignment with common conventions, and also aligns with other help commands in the nuget cli.

I later realized you can also do `nuget help config`, but again I've found it more common you ask for help after the command you want help with, and not the other way around.


NuGet product used: `NuGet.exe`

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):  `5.1.0.6013`

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): `Win10 v1809 17763.529`

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Nuget.exe sources add does not work if nuget.config does not have proper section" (#1589) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The sources add command does not add the package source into the nuget config if the nuget.config  doesn‚Äôt already have both a <clear/> element and an existing package source. The command output of sources add is "package sources added successfully", while there is no package source added at all.

How to repo:
1. Change the nuget.config to only including following
`<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
   <configuration />`
2. Run nuget.exe Sources add -name {sourceName} -source {source}
3.The output is "Package Source with Name: {sourceName} added successfully."
4.Check nuget.config, no source has been added at all.

This bug is that nuget.exe fails to add the package source, while claims it added successfully.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Create a Mono TFM" (#2320) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
_Copied from https://github.com/aspnet/dnx/issues/2118:_

_We want to create a TFM for DNX on Mono: dnxmono. It should probably be tied to Mono version. It should also inherit from a dnx (desktop CLR) TFM._

_We'll want to get this in to NuGet as well._

---

Having a Mono-specific TFM would help fix this kind of issues: https://github.com/AzureAD/azure-activedirectory-identitymodel-extensions-for-dotnet/issues/179#issuecomment-155884377.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Pack should fail on unrecognized frameworks" (#2301) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Pack converts unknown frameworks to `Unsupported0.0` in the nuspec for unknown group target frameworks. This often goes unnoticed by package authors and results in a broken package when an older version of NuGet.exe is used by mistake to pack.

Pack should instead fail and error out without creating the nupkg. This should contain a message letting the user know which framework is not recognized and suggesting that they fix their nuspec or update nuget.exe.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet.exe console logging abstraction" (#2036) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
NuGet.exe currently logs directly to the console. Instead it should hold an ILogger abstraction that passes messages through to the console.

This would allow better unit and functional testing, and get the command line tests closer to being able to run in parallel.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "NuGet visual studio not showing logs when the Build output windows is not opened" (#1309) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: When packages are restored and the build Output windows is not initiated, we are not showing any action logs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "[CPVM-Perf] Improve Noop GetHash for the CPVM projects" (#10004) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

During the restore the dgspec hash is cached to a file to be used be subsequent noop restores. The hash calculation uses json writer to get dgspec string representation of the dgspec. When the list of cpvm versions is large this can have a large impact on hash calculation ( three times higher for a cpvm file with 283 versions)

This issue is for tracking the work to reduce this difference as much as possible. 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/16580006/92291099-d35bc500-eecb-11ea-90a3-de7efe0ee769.png)

Either modify the version spec of dependency "Microsoft.VisualStudio.RpcContracts [16.5.33-alpha, )" or update the version field in the nuspec. 
```
##[error]packages\nuget.build.tasks.pack\5.7.0\build\NuGet.Build.Tasks.Pack.targets(198,5): Error NU5104: A stable release of a package should not have a prerelease dependency. Either modify the version spec of dependency "System.Security.Cryptography.Cng [5.0.0-preview.3.20214.6, )" or update the version field in the nuspec.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Automatic formatting with `dotnet format`" (#9917) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
We should start enforcing code style through `dotnet format`. This will help us spend less time asking folks for miscellaneous style changes during code review, and catch it when we happen to miss something. Once the PR lands, it means in the future we'll stop having random formatting changes along with code PRs, hopefully.

As part of this task, we should also automate style verification on CI

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Adding a link to View READMEs from the PM UI" (#9890) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: Adding a hyperlink that allows users to view the README file for a package while using the PM UI.
